step1.sentence: The comment section quickly got out of hand and the moderators had to shut it down.

step2.story: What started as a friendly debate about the office coffee machine got out of hand when old workplace grievances surfaced. The manager ended the meeting early and sent a follow-up email asking everyone to cool down.

step3.story: The annual neighborhood block party had always been a low-key afternoon of lawn chairs and homemade potato salad. This year, someone decided to rent a sound system. Then someone else added a bouncy castle. Then two competing grill stations appeared. By four in the afternoon there were nearly two hundred people, the music was audible from four streets over, and a minor dispute had broken out over parking. The original organizer stood on the curb looking at everything she had not planned for, shaking her head. It had completely gotten out of hand — and yet everyone was having a tremendous time.
